notes: Exact claim match (C82–C87). LLM deems reproducibility and donor/batch findings supported; reviewers caution that batch effects may drive signals and request broader tests and variance explained, so they rate these claims as uncertain.

Substantial but non-identical overlap; shared claims include C21, C22, C27, C28, C30, C31, C32, C57. LLM supports simulation-based superiority and accuracy; reviewers question fairness of method comparisons and K selection, leading to uncertainty. Extra LLM-only claims (e.g., C24, C25, C26) and peer-only (e.g., C5, C29) complicate direct concordance.

Partial overlap on simulation/method setup (C24, C26). LLM interprets simulations and consensus approach as supportive; reviewers flag insufficient methodological detail and parameter justification, rating related claims uncertain.

Overlap on stimulus-responsive programs in cortex (C48–C51); both support recovery and replication of ERP/LRPs with expected layer patterns. Peer result includes additional applications not covered by LLM R3.
Shared claims (C33, C39, C40, C6) on organoid identity/activity programs and disentangling activity; both support. Each result also contains non-overlapping claims.

Shared claims (C52, C54) on neurosecretory and synaptogenesis programs; both support their existence/GO coherence. LLM also includes C53 and C55; peer includes additional application claims beyond these.
Novelty claim about prior benchmarks (C16) is only evaluated by LLM and rated uncertain; no corresponding peer review assessment found.
Peer-only assessment of K-selection guidance and robustness (C61, C79) marked uncertain; no corresponding LLM result addressing these claims.
